-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckService_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-OverrideNotFound.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckService_String_OverrideNotFound$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-Status.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckService_String_Status$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command '$ifw_api_command$'

7.description: Status for the specified service or services to check against.
7.caption: Status

9.description:
This will tell the plugin to return OK instead of UNKNOWN, in case no service was added to this
check
9.caption: MitigateUnknown

10.description:
This argument will allow you to override the default behavior of the plugin in case a service was not found on the
system. By default, it will report UNKNOWN but you can set with this argument if the service state should be
OK, WARNING or CRITICAL instead
10.caption: OverrideNotFound

12.description: Disables the performance data output of this plugin
12.caption: NoPerfData

11.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
11.caption: Verbosity

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/110-Installation/06-Collect-Metrics-over-Time/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

6.description:
Allows to exclude services which might come in handy for checking services which are configured to start automatically
on Windows but are not running and weren't exited properly.
6.caption: Exclude

5.description:
Used to specify an array of services which should be checked against the status. Supports '*' for
wildcards.
5.caption: Service

8.description:
Allows to include only services with a specific startup type inside the monitoring,
in case you check for a list of specific services by using `-Service`
8.caption: FilterStartupType
